summary: Mod Organizer is the best mod manager I have ever used but I always found the default Mod Organizer categories out of place so I decided to change them to suit with Skyrim Nexus.
descriptionHtml:
Mod Organizer is the best mod manager I have ever used but I always found the default Mod Organizer categories out of place so I decided to modify them to fit with Skyrim Nexus. It's a simple .dat file for those who likes to keep their mod list organized. I have also linked them to the Skyrim Nexus so when you download a mod with MO and install it, that mod will be automatically be categorized. Some categories like ENB Presents and Saved Games has been left out since they can't be installed with MO, others has been merged into one category to make it look less cluttered. This .dat does change the parent ID of the default Mod Organizer so some mods that have already been assigned by you are required to be reassigned.


Categories
----------------
+Bugfixes
+Patches
+Tweaks
+Utilities
+UI
+Audio
+Timesaver
+Animation
+Immersion
+NPCs
+Follower
+Creatures
+Landscape
+Retexture
+Models
+Follower
+Gameplay
+Skill & Combat
+Overhaul
+Magic
+Location
>Abode
>Town
>Dungeon
+Adventure
>Quest
>Expansion
>Collectables
+Equipment
>Pack
>Armour
>Weapon
>Clothing
+Visual


Requirements
----------------
- Mod Organizer (Version 1.2.17 or higher)
- A smile


Installation
----------------
Put "categories.dat" inside your Mod Organizer directory (the folder where ModOrganizer.exe is located).
Overwrite.


Uninstallation
----------------
Delete "categories.dat", Mod Organizer will automatically generate the default one once you start it after 
deleting "categories.dat".


Thanks
----------------
All the Mod Organizer devs
adelinadragonborn for pointing out flaws and suggesting fixes
My love Bethesda 
U for reading the "Thanks" section
author: Futureops
